description.narrative: The project is intended to contribute to at least in the reduction of the growth rate of GHG emissions from the dieselbased power generation in Palau The project purpose is the facilitation of the reduction of imported fossil fuel consumption through the widespread application of Renewable Energy Technologies RETs not only to meet the electricity needs of the country but also provide the other energy requirements for productive uses in the other major sectors of the national economy The main outcome of the project is the effective utilization and realization of benefits from the use of the countrys feasible Renewable Energy RE resources

description.narrative: Mainstreaming Global Environmental Priorities into National Policies and Programmes

title.narrative: Palau CB2CCCD Project AWP 2015_revised_GoPAug 2015 UNDP endorsed
Palau CB2CCD Project AWP 2015_revised_UNDP cover letter

description.narrative: The project objective is to strengthen Palau's capacities to meet national and global environmental commitments to the three Rio Conventions through improved management of environmental data and information.
capital of a political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

For ATLAS Output 1: 1.1: Adequate national standards, norms, procedures for collecting and storing environmental data are officially in place. 1.2: An environmental data repository architecture in place. 1.3: Information technologies in place to collect, store and share giving access to up-to-date environmental information. 1.4: Agreements for data sharing in place.
For ATLAS Output 2: 2.1: An in-service training programme for public servants include course(s) covering environmental information management. 2.2: Number of Environmental Officers trained by taking the course(s) developed with the support of the project. 2.3: Use up-to-date environmental information in decision-making and policy-making.
For ATLAS Output 3: 3.1: An operational inter-sectorial coordination mechanism that build on existing instruments such as OERC, NEPC, PNRC, NPC, etc. 3.2: Endorsed action plans for implementing MEAs supporting government's MEA obligations.

comment.narrative: 1.1: Draft official standards, norms and procedures for review by the relevant organizations. 1.2: Identified environmental data, reporting obligations, and information needs of key stakeholders. 1.3: Hardware, communication and networking equipment required to collect and store environmental data are identified. 1.4: Existing protocols for environmental data-sharing are reviewed.

1.1: A confirmed inventory of environmental information data sets compiled in Palau. 1.2: A validated environmental reporting obligations and environmental information needs of key stakeholders. 1.3: An identified list of information technologies (IT) used for existing databases and information systems. 2.1: A training needs analysis is undertaken on new and improved data and information collection and measurement methodologies. 2.2: Training activity delivered on new and improved data and information collection and measurement methodologies. 3.1: A policy decision-making mechanism (i.e. the National Environmental Protection Council Unit) is re-activated with an establishment of a Secretariat Unit, based in the Bureau of Budget and Planning, Ministry of Finance. 3.2: The Palau National Environmental Protection Council’s 2016 Year in Review is completed and the first internal evaluation of the National Environmental Protection Council (NEPC) is completed.

1.1: Adequate official standards, norms and procedures are developed and validated by the relevant organizations. 1.2: Environmental data is collected and stored by key organizations in a harmonized and structured way and easily accessible. 1.3: Hardware, communication and networking equipment is being developed to collect and store environmental data and provide easy access to this environmental information. 1.4: 3-4 agreements are developed between key environmental organizations and 3-4 agencies/institutions to formally share data on a regular basis. 2.1: Course(s) on environmental information management is trialled as in-service training for public administrators. 2.2: 50 Environmental Officers are trained using the new training programme. 3.1: Coordinating MEAs implementation including a broader stakeholder involvement. 3.2: Renewed commitments to implement MEAs in annual work plans with specific budgets and an improve multi-sectoral approach. Greater national budget allocation to the environment sector.

description.narrative: To mainstream conservation and biodiversity safeguards into landscape, forest and seascape planning and management and into key productive and economic sectors in Palau.

description.narrative: 4 States in Palau (Executive and Legislative branches) have enhanced capacities to plan and manage public resources to deliver basic services to their constituencies

activity-description.narrative: Strengthening capabilities of State governors, legislators and staff on their roles, functions and duties

description.narrative: Accountability - local government finance

Output 2: The Ministry of State (Bureau of Domestic Affairs) has enhanced capacities to support State governments and facilitates relations and operations between central administrations, the Senate, the House of Delegates and State governments.
capital of a political entity

activity-description.narrative: Capacities strengthened at national government to support State Government, including facilitation of better relations between different arms of Government.

description.narrative: Accountability - local government finance

Output 3: Local residents from 4 States, including youth and women, have increased understanding of central and local governments’ roles and responsibilities and participate more actively in local decision making and oversight.
